medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient initially presented with acute renal colic in 1995, which at that time led to the discovery of primary hyperparathyroidism (PHPT). She was lost to follow-up for 7 years and then readmitted with recurring posterior neck pain. There were no symptoms of hypercalcemia, bone pain, or fractures.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of acute renal colic in 1995 and PHPT with known high levels of intact PTH and serum calcium.
medical_history.family_history: Family history negative for osteoporosis, renal stones, or parathyroid disease.
medical_history.social_history: The patient denied use of thiazide diuretics, lithium, herbal supplements, or vitamins. She did not smoke, drink alcohol, or use illicit drugs.
